intro: Drypetes sibuyanensis, commonly known as the Sibuyan flame tree, is a tropical tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a smooth surface. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and parks.
